definitions: unsolicited electronic messages sent in bulk, typically for advertising purposes
processed meat product made from pork shoulder and ham
examples: My inbox receives hundreds of spam messages every single day
The company uses filters to block spam from reaching employees
She fried spam slices for breakfast with scrambled eggs
During wartime, spam became a staple food in many households

definitions: distance or measurement between two points or extremities of something
period of time during which something exists or happens
section of a bridge between two supports or pillars
examples: The bird's wingspan measured six feet from tip to tip
The span between the two towers exceeded one thousand meters
His attention span lasted barely ten minutes during lectures
The empire's span of influence covered three centuries completely
Engineers reinforced each span before the bridge reopened to traffic
The central span collapsed during the earthquake last year

definitions: synthetic elastic fiber used in clothing that stretches and returns to original shape
examples: Her yoga pants contained twenty percent spandex for flexibility
The swimsuit's spandex material dried quickly after swimming sessions

definitions: medium-sized dog breed with long ears and silky coat, originally bred for hunting
examples: Their cocker spaniel loved playing fetch in the backyard
The springer spaniel flushed birds from the undergrowth expertly

definitions: act of striking someone, especially a child, on the buttocks as punishment
brisk, lively, or vigorous pace or manner of movement
examples: Many parents now avoid spanking as a disciplinary method entirely
The school banned spanking decades ago following parent complaints
The horses maintained a spanking pace throughout the morning ride
They set off at a spanking rate down the country road

definitions: tool with fixed or adjustable jaws for gripping and turning nuts or bolts
examples: The mechanic reached for a spanner to tighten the bolt
Someone threw a spanner in the works by canceling suddenly

definitions: strong pole used as a mast or yard on a ship
practice boxing match or light fighting between partners
crystalline mineral that breaks along flat planes when struck
examples: The ship's main spar cracked during the violent storm yesterday
Workers replaced the damaged spar before the vessel departed
The boxers would spar three rounds every morning before breakfast
They often spar verbally during committee meetings about policy
The geologist identified feldspar crystals embedded in the granite rock
Iceland spar exhibits double refraction when light passes through

definitions: extra item kept in reserve for use as a replacement
time available for leisure when not occupied with obligations
knocking down all ten pins with two consecutive balls in bowling
examples: Keep a spare tire in your trunk for emergencies always
The technician installed the spare part within thirty minutes
She reads novels in her spare time after work daily
Finding spare moments for relaxation proves increasingly difficult nowadays
He bowled three spares and two strikes last night impressively
Converting that spare required precise aim and steady nerves

definitions: small fiery particle thrown off from a fire or produced by friction
small amount of something that triggers a larger reaction or development
examples: Sparks flew when the metal grinder touched the steel surface
A single spark from the campfire ignited the dry grass
Her comment provided the spark for a heated debate afterwards
That invention sparked a revolution in communication technology worldwide

definitions: bright points of light that flash and shimmer on a surface
lively and witty quality in a person's manner or expression
examples: The diamond's sparkle caught everyone's attention at the party
Morning dew created sparkle across the spider's intricate web
Her sparkle and charm made her popular among colleagues immediately
The performer lost his sparkle after years of touring

definitions: containing bubbles of carbon dioxide gas, especially in beverages
shining brightly with flashes of light or brilliance
examples: She preferred sparkling water to still water with meals
The sparkling wine complemented the celebration perfectly last night
Her sparkling jewelry drew admiring glances throughout the evening
The lake's sparkling surface reflected the afternoon sunlight beautifully

definitions: practice fighting in boxing or martial arts without intent to harm
engaging in argument or dispute, especially in a playful manner
examples: Daily sparring sessions improved his defensive techniques significantly overall
The gym scheduled sparring matches every Friday afternoon regularly
Their constant sparring over politics entertained dinner guests thoroughly
The lawyers' sparring continued throughout the lengthy trial proceedings

definitions: small brown bird common in many parts of the world, known for chirping
examples: House sparrows gathered around the bird feeder every morning
A sparrow built its nest under the roof eaves carefully

definitions: sudden involuntary contraction of a muscle or group of muscles
sudden brief spell of activity, emotion, or sensation
examples: Back spasms kept him bedridden for three days straight
The muscle spasm occurred without warning during the race
A spasm of coughing interrupted her presentation several times repeatedly
He felt spasms of guilt whenever he remembered the incident

definitions: petty quarrel or dispute between people, usually brief
protective covering for the ankle and shoe, worn over footwear
examples: Their spat over dinner plans resolved quickly without lasting damage
The siblings' spat ended when their mother intervened firmly
He wore white spats over his dress shoes for the formal event
Victorian gentlemen often wore spats to protect expensive footwear

definitions: large number of similar things happening within a short period of time
examples: A spate of burglaries worried residents throughout the neighborhood recently
The spate of resignations left the company severely understaffed immediately

definitions: broad flat implement used for lifting, spreading, or turning food during cooking
examples: She flipped pancakes expertly using a silicone spatula yesterday morning
The chef used a spatula to spread frosting evenly everywhere

definitions: eggs of fish, frogs, or other aquatic animals laid in water
starting point or origin from which something develops or grows
examples: Salmon return upstream to lay spawn in their birthplace annually
The pond contained masses of frog spawn every spring season
His research spawned numerous innovations in medical technology subsequently
That decision would spawn consequences lasting for decades afterwards

definitions: illicit establishment selling alcoholic beverages, especially during Prohibition era in America
examples: The speakeasy operated behind a flower shop during Prohibition secretly
Modern bars styled as speakeasies require passwords for entry sometimes

definitions: person who delivers a speech or participates in conversation
electroacoustic device that converts electrical signals into audible sound
presiding officer in a legislative assembly or parliament
examples: The keynote speaker captivated the audience for forty minutes straight
Native speakers provide authentic language models for students learning
These wireless speakers produce exceptional sound quality throughout the room
He connected external speakers to improve his computer's audio
The Speaker of the House controls the legislative agenda effectively
Parliament elected a new Speaker following the previous resignation

definitions: act or skill of expressing thoughts and ideas through spoken words
activity of giving speeches or presentations to audiences
examples: Her speaking voice carried clearly across the crowded auditorium
Generally speaking, the project exceeded all initial expectations significantly
Public speaking terrifies many people more than death itself supposedly
She earns substantial income from corporate speaking engagements annually

definitions: weapon with a pointed tip on a long shaft used for thrusting or throwing
young shoot of a plant, especially asparagus emerging from ground
examples: Ancient warriors hunted with spears before developing other weapons
The museum displayed ceremonial spears from various African cultures
Fresh asparagus spears taste best when lightly steamed or grilled
Bamboo spears grow incredibly fast during the rainy season

definitions: pointed tip of a spear designed for penetration
person or group that leads an attack, movement, or development
examples: Archaeologists discovered bronze spearheads dating from ancient settlements there
The spearhead broke off during the hunting expedition yesterday
She spearheaded the campaign for environmental protection throughout the region
The company spearheaded innovations in renewable energy technology globally

definitions: detailed description of design, materials, or workmanship for something
work done without guaranteed payment in hope of future profit
examples: The architect provided detailed specs for the construction project yesterday
These technical specs outline every component requirement precisely written
Writers often submit manuscripts on spec to publishers hopefully
The designer created logos on spec for potential clients

definitions: featured item or promotion offered temporarily at reduced price
person considered particularly important or having unique qualities
examples: Today's lunch special includes soup and sandwich for ten dollars
The restaurant features daily specials based on fresh ingredients
Every parent thinks their child is special and uniquely gifted
She made him feel special with thoughtful birthday surprises

definitions: process of concentrating on and becoming expert in a particular subject or skill area
examples: Medical specialisation requires years of additional training after graduation
The university offers specialisation in marine biology starting junior year

definitions: particular area of knowledge or skill in which someone has specialized
examples: Her specialism in cardiac surgery made her highly sought after
The consultant's specialism covered international tax law exclusively there

definitions: person who concentrates primarily on a particular subject or activity with expert knowledge
examples: The heart specialist recommended immediate surgery following test results
She consulted a specialist about her rare skin condition

definitions: product or service for which a person or place is particularly known
branch of medicine or surgery in which a doctor specializes
examples: The restaurant's speciality is fresh seafood prepared Mediterranean style
Handmade chocolates are the shop's speciality since opening decades ago
His medical speciality focuses on pediatric neurology exclusively now
Choosing a speciality requires careful consideration during residency training

definitions: process of concentrating on and becoming expert in a particular area or skill
examples: Economic specialization increases productivity through focused skill development naturally
Her specialization in forensic accounting proved invaluable during investigations

definitions: particular area of expertise or concentrated professional focus
distinctive product or service that distinguishes a business or person
examples: Emergency medicine became his specialty after completing residency training
The lawyer's specialty involves complex international merger negotiations exclusively
The bakery's specialty is gluten-free pastries made fresh daily
Regional specialties attract tourists seeking authentic local cuisine experiences

definitions: group of living organisms consisting of similar individuals capable of exchanging genes
examples: Scientists discovered a new species of butterfly in the rainforest
Endangered species require immediate conservation efforts to survive extinction

definitions: precise detail or item explicitly stated rather than implied or general
examples: She requested specifics about the contract terms before signing anything
The specifics of the plan remain confidential until announcement tomorrow

definitions: detailed description of design, materials, and workmanship for manufacturing or construction
examples: The engineering specifications required precise measurements throughout the project
Product specifications must meet industry standards before market release

definitions: quality of being specific, detailed, or exact in nature or effect
examples: The test's specificity determines its ability to identify negative cases
Greater specificity in instructions reduces errors during assembly significantly

definitions: very small spot, mark, or piece of a substance
examples: A speck of dust triggered his allergic reaction immediately yesterday
Tiny specks of gold glittered in the prospector's pan

definitions: small spot or patch of color or light different from surroundings
examples: Brown speckles covered the bird's eggs for natural camouflage protection
Speckles of paint dotted the artist's workspace floor everywhere

definitions: visually striking performance, display, or event that attracts attention
pair of glasses worn to correct or protect vision
examples: The fireworks created a magnificent spectacle against the night sky
He made a spectacle of himself at the formal dinner
Her antique spectacles belonged to her great-grandmother originally once
Wire-rimmed spectacles gave him a scholarly appearance instantly

definitions: elaborate and impressive entertainment or display meant to dazzle audiences
examples: The circus spectacular featured acrobats and exotic animals performing
Broadway spectaculars require massive budgets for production values alone

definitions: person who watches a show, game, or other event without participating
examples: Thousands of spectators filled the stadium for the championship game
Spectators lined the parade route hours before it began

definitions: ghost or ghostly apparition that appears to haunt places
something widely feared as a possible dangerous occurrence
examples: Local legends tell of a specter haunting the abandoned mansion
The specter appeared at midnight according to witness accounts
The specter of war loomed over diplomatic negotiations constantly present
Economic collapse remained a specter throughout the crisis period

definitions: ghost or phantom appearance believed to haunt specific locations
something widely feared as a possible unpleasant or dangerous occurrence
examples: The castle's spectre reportedly walks the battlements nightly still
Witnesses described the spectre as a woman in white
The spectre of unemployment haunts recent college graduates increasingly
Climate change raises the spectre of environmental catastrophe globally

definitions: entire range or scope of related activities, ideas, or phenomena
band of colors produced when light passes through a prism
examples: Political opinions span the entire spectrum from left to right
The autism spectrum includes diverse behavioral and communication patterns
The visible spectrum contains all colors perceivable by human eyes
Scientists analyzed the star's spectrum to determine its composition

definitions: forming of theory or conjecture without firm evidence or proof
investment in stocks or property hoping to gain from fluctuations
examples: Media speculation about the merger proved completely unfounded eventually
Scientific speculation preceded actual discovery by several decades historically
Property speculation drove housing prices beyond sustainable levels rapidly
His speculation in commodities resulted in substantial losses unfortunately

definitions: person who invests in stocks or property hoping to profit from fluctuations
examples: Property speculators bought entire neighborhoods for future development
Currency speculators bet against the pound during the crisis

definitions: formal address or discourse delivered to an audience
faculty or act of speaking to express thoughts and feelings
examples: The president's speech addressed concerns about economic recovery comprehensively
She rehearsed her wedding speech countless times before delivery
Stroke affected his speech but not his cognitive abilities significantly
Children develop speech at different rates during early years

definitions: person who writes speeches for another person to deliver publicly
examples: The senator's speechwriter crafted powerful messages for campaign rallies
Presidential speechwriters work under intense deadline pressure constantly

definitions: rate at which someone or something moves or operates
amphetamine drug used as a stimulant, often illegally
examples: The car's speed exceeded ninety miles per hour dangerously
Internet speed determines streaming quality for video content significantly
Police arrested dealers selling speed near the nightclub district
Speed addiction destroyed his health and career completely eventually

definitions: small fast motorboat designed for high velocity travel on water
examples: The speedboat raced across the lake at dawn impressively
Tourists enjoyed speedboat tours around the tropical islands daily

definitions: act of driving faster than the legal speed limit
examples: His speeding ticket cost two hundred dollars plus court fees
Speeding causes thousands of preventable accidents every year nationwide
